div.div:
Sensor Power Cycle
Disable all unpaired nodes
Set conflict check timer

div.div:
Conflict Check
Read STATUS register of slave 0x62

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 680px; margin-left: 690px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: #ffffff; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 557px; margin-left: 631px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Node Startup
Set currentSensor to any unpaired sensor
Enable currentSensor
Set startup timer
Unset addrConflict

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 430px; margin-left: 255px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: #ffffff; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 397px; margin-left: 431px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Address Conflict
Log error
Set addrConflict flag
Set retry timer (1sec)
Disable all nodes

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 760px; margin-left: 590px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: #ffffff; white-space: nowrap;

display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 717px; margin-left: 631px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Node Pair
Read serial number of slave 0x62
Write serial number to 0x62 to unlock
Set address of 0x62
Record serial number
If any ACK's are not received, abort with success = FALSE. Otherwise, set success = TRUE

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 727px; margin-left: 431px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Node Pair Done
Disable 0x62 address using new address
If ACK received, mark sensor as paired

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 510px; margin-left: 240px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: #ffffff; white-space: nowrap;

display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 477px; margin-left: 31px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 238px; height: 1px; padding-top: 337px; margin-left: 592px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #333333; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
One subtle corner case:
IF a sensor reboots due to a power blip, AND we didn't notice by NodeStartup, AND it comes back up before the startup timer fires and transitions to NodeConfigure: THEN we may configure the wrong sensor.
But, assuming the enable hardlines are set correctly, this will work itself out. Once we detect the sensor has gone down, we'll disable it via hardline in SensorPowerCycle; this will cause the misconfigured sensor to go down as well, at which point configuration proceeds as normal.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 398px; height: 1px; padding-top: 7px; margin-left: 2px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #333333; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
LidarLiteBank identifies which Lidar sensors are connected over I2C, and initializes them to the correct address(es). It then passes control of each sensor to the corresponding LidarLite, which configures the sensor and begins a read loop.
Key features:
1. Correctly identifies which sensor is which using the enable lines
2. Automatically reconnects to sensors when they are power cycled
3. Sensors are hot-pluggable and can be replaced even while the controller is running
4. Handles all sensors fairly and separately; i.e. If one sensor is missing, the others will still auto-connect just fine.
Notes:
- In the NodeStartup state, currentSensor is selected by incrementing the counter from its previous value (mod NUM_SENSORS) until an unpaired sensor is found. This ensures that, if one device is missing, the other devices can still be paired, as currentSensor won't get "stuck" on the missing sensor.
- Per the datasheet, startup time is about 22ms. The startup timer (and the duplicate startup timer) is set at 50ms. If a sensor takes longer than this to come up, the pairing process will fail.

switch.text: LidarLiteBank identifies which Lidar sensors are connected over I2...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 347px; margin-left: 392px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #333333; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: addrConflict flag is used by API to report hardware error
